topics.body:
And to interrupt the conversation: I've had a song from the fandom stuck in my head and I'm having issues locating it. I hear it a lot on the Pony Fortress servers, because it's the special song that plays when Celestia uses her rage ability.

I tried checking their site and their Wiki but neither can answer me.

Anyways, maybe a blind shout into the dark here will I help. I know it's a parody since it's set to the tune of Kanye West's POWER. However any relevant searches merely brings up the parody of the music video used for the first Anthology. Beyond that, the only line I can remember is "Mmm, bananas do you like 'em?" which is just as unhelpful as it being to the tune of POWER; I just get Friendship is Magic Bitch.

So now I try to forget again over The Black Crowes so it doesn't nag or distract me and I can do some studying.

Oh great. Mormons. 
No sir, I have not.[/bq]
Good morning sir.  Ghost in the shell is essentially the deus ex of the 90's, but far more philosophy.  It features motoko, a ex-soldier cyborg who is a police officer.  In the original movie she goes up against a ai who gained sapience and gained a soul merging together with him.  The first season of the tv show is around infamous hacker called, "the laughing man" who made his debut after threatening a ceo of a cybernetics company at gun point while hacking everyone's cybernetic eyes, the tv station and all people in real time and then when the ceo refused to admit his criminal actions was forced into hiding.

The laughing man resurfaces after a assassination attempt with several people trying to assassinate the same man.  When the file that proves the corruption of the political individuals involved the corrupt politicians pull strings with the military to kill everyone involved and kill the police officers investigating and kill the person who no longer can stomach his hand in what they have done.  The question is what could be so horrid that a kid would put a gun to a ceo's head telling him to tell the truth and so horrid that the military would be called into with tanks to kill a entire police department, in the middle of a major city no less, so as that it would never see the light of day?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Well may day got shat all over:
*ALL* seven of my nephews and nieces visited the last two days; they broke the tub, broke the sink, I'm the one getting fucking yelled at and the nephew who knows how to fix this stuff I got told, "Well I don't know if your brother will allow him to come fix it".  They caused potentially thousands of dollars worth of damage and you won't even get the one person that can fucking fix it and are yelling at me instead?

If someone's kids break something then it's their responsibility.

Sort of.  My sister was visiting so my brother brought his kids to see their cousins for the first time in three years.

Well my brother came over and told him what happened; we're going to have to go under the house, uncouple the piping, fish out the toy that got stuck and then reattach it.  At least he's helping, cause his kids broke everything and doesn't want to get a bill if it's broke broke.
